page.title: 15THE QUARRY
page.content: The site of the quarry is on the corner of Rowson St. and Mt. Pleasant Rd. The quarry was dug on land known as Little Brighton Common, and today the pub opposite is called the Little Brighton, but locals call it the Ginny. The quarry began in 1889 and stone from it was used locally for walls and in St. Hilary's Church. A lady who has lived nearby for 70 years told us that many Welsh people worked at the quarry and lived near it. In 1912 the quarry closed. Alderman James Smith gave the land to Wallasey. It became a park and the stone entrance tells about this. In the centre of the park was a Chinese Pavilion, but it burned down. Today the park has 2 bowling greens and a playground. The park has a mens' toilet, but no ladies. (2aM 1985).
